text: hey! Does anyone have the skillset/knowledge to aid me in building a job board that pulls the data from an API upon each filter/search? I have one in place atm that pulls in the jobs to a hubdb table but its too slow to be functional.

hi everyone.
I got this issue with <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/properties|Rest API>
• I can create a property group
• I can *NOT* delete a property group.
what I get is:
```"errorType": "API-ERROR",
"internalError": ""```
I think my inputs (public key, scopes, ..) are good, since I can create a group.

Hey everyone,

Can we batch-create several deals via the *`/crm/v3/objects/deals`* somehow? Or is import API the only way for that right now? :pray:

yes <@UFCEFABV5> you can create batch deals by following this endpoint - `*`/crm/v3/objects/deals/batch/create`*
`
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/deals>
<@U05CVF7KGAK> are you sending the request of type `DELETE` ?
yes
and is there any property assigned to that property group?
nope, group without properties
btw : same error with a group that contains props
last time i used it worked for me, havent tested it recently, but have you tried from the api interface or postman?

thats what I do : from Postman.
I like to be facing the API directly, without any middleware in between
just tested and it worked for me!

Oh well I omitted :
I use Postman but in-between there is Pathfix pass-through.
But Pathfix got same error as above from Hubpost.
try from the HubSpot interface, and then you can also get the code just like postman in your preferred language
I'll have to ask for a accesss token to Pathfix that they are not meant to provide haha
Does anyone have any good resources for setting the values of rich text fields via the API?
Hello everyone
<@U01DSSS4Z6D> :point_up_2:

Hi everyone, I'm having trouble with associating newly created line items to deals, both through including the assocation information in the 'HubSpotClient.crm.lineItems.batchApi.create' request and adding the associations after, using the 'HubSpotClient.crm.associationsApi.create' request. I just end up with completely unassociated line items sort of floating in the ether. Has anyone else had this problem?
Wasted 2 hours for the same problem last week, try using API directly without the HubSpot SDK, it will work
I've wasted multiple days :laughing:, I think I must've tried every API that relates to associations in any way. I'll try that out, tysm
That's an example I used (if you want to take a look if there's something wrong in the payload)
Yep exactly how I was trying to do it too.
Let me know if it works using axios, for me that solved the issue
Is axios included in the custom code blocks through workflows do you know?
yes you can include it adding `const axios = require('axios');`  at the top
YES! It works! Thanks so much man haha, I was tearing my hair out over this

Hi everyone,
I'm trying to create a private app in HubSpot using settings > integrations > private apps.
But I get the following message when I try to select `analytics.behavioral_events.send` in scopes
Any idea what this could be? I'm a super admin in HubSpot
I’ve never used this scope for a private app but I guess your HubSpot plan does not include behavioural event, therefore is not available as a scope

Suddenly getting these errors and the actual workflow enrollments are failing saying that the custom code failed to execute, any idea what 'There was a network error while running your test. Please wait a minute and try reloading the page.' means?
Cheers thanks, I'll ask HubSpot whether this is the case
I have a question about Webhooks - is it possible to listen for ANY contact field to be updated? Or do I have to listen to only specific fields?

My initial thought was using the last modified property, but I'm not sure if that's available if I check this post: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Contact-Updated-webhook-for-any-property/m-p/241391|https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Contact-Updated-webhook-for-any-property/m-p/241391>
Anyone experience any outage on API call in the last few hours? My usual API call to update companies is failing and response "Resource not found". Of coz the company is on our portal for sure.
Yes but seems to be resolved now for me, custom code execution wasn't working and heard from team mates that some of the stuff on the site wasn't working
<https://status.HubSpot.com/history>
Thanks for the response Luke! :+1:
Thanks for this, looks like a basic request that they just havent implemented yet. Back to the drawing board I go.
